articles.title: More signs point to terrorist links to train gunman
articles.summary: The gunman in Friday's thwarted attack of a high-speed train bound for Paris flew to Istanbul from Berlin on May 10, following a path that has been used hundreds of times by Islamist militants seeking to join the Islamic State group.

articles.title: Big 400m personal best for Anneliese Rubie
articles.summary: Anneliese Rubie has become the first Australian woman since Cathy Freeman in 1999 to qualify for the 400m semis at the world athletics championships.

articles.title: Ginger snaps: hundreds gather to celebrate all things red-haired
articles.summary: Hundreds of redheads have gathered in Ireland to celebrate their flamed locks and everything to do with them.

articles.title: Britain and Iran take diplomatic approach as embassies reopen
articles.summary: The re-establishment of a British diplomatic presence in Tehran is another milestone in the Islamic republic's cautiously improving ties with the West.

articles.title: Groth advances in Winston-Salem
articles.summary: Australia's Sam Groth is through to the next round of the Winston Salem Open after a hard-fought win over wildcard Jared Donaldson.

articles.title: Ko wins Canadian Pacific Open title
articles.summary: New Zealand golfer Lydia Ko has won the Canadian Pacific Open title for the third time, getting past American Stacy Lewis on the first play-off hole.

articles.title: Cook not worried about dead rubber loss
articles.summary: England skipper Alastair Cook isn't too worried about the innings and 46-run loss in the fifth Ashes Test, acknowledging his side failed to get up for it.

articles.title: Japan protests Russian PM Dmitry Medvedev visit to disputed island
articles.summary: Japan on Saturday lodged a protest over Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev's visit to one of four disputed Pacific islands which have strained ties between the two countries since the end of World War Two.

articles.title: Hayne lights up NFL pre-season again
articles.summary: Jarryd Hayne has impressed in his second pre-season game with the San Francisco 49ers.

articles.title: Wilson in coma after IndyCar race crash
articles.summary: English driver Justin Wilson is in a coma after crashing during the Indycar race in Pocono, Pennsylvania.

articles.title: North, South Korea hold marathon talks in bid to end stand-off
articles.summary: Top aides to the leaders of North and South Korea negotiated overnight and into Monday morning in a marathon bid to try to ease tensions involving an exchange of artillery fire that has brought the peninsula to the brink of armed conflict.

articles.title: Test retirement hasn't sunk in: Clarke
articles.summary: Outgoing Australia captain Michael Clarke now accepts it is the right time to retire, but says the end of his cricket career hasn't sunk in.

articles.title: Barcelona win but Real falter
articles.summary: The Spanish League is up and running with Real falling behind champions Barcelona in the opening weekend.
